title: The Way of Ages: Unearthing the Practical Essence of Ancient Wisdom
description: While similarity and correlation don’t automatically imply viability, finding a close match or discovering a large overlap between independent schools of thought, particularly those schools which have passed Einstein’s test of experience, lends a great deal of credibility to the common elements. Even in science, the idea of certainty is approached with caution. “As far as the propositions of mathematics refer to reality they are not certain,” Dr. Einstein explains; “and as far as they are certain they do not refer to reality.” The scientific method uses confirmation and correlation to move incrementally closer to certainty but always stops short of declaring it complete; so should we proceed in moral and ethical philosophy so as to not only keep up with science but to converge with it.  For use in the Kindle desktop or Kindle iOS mobile app, the Kindle Voyage or on any Kindle Fire or newer device including Android phones and tablets. Not supported on earlier Kindle devices. Not yet tested on other devices.  The Companion Volume to this work is “Profound Accordance: Lao Tzu's Treatise on the Way of Heaven - A New Translation of the Tao Te Ching with Notes and Commentary” by D.L. Sieving.
author: David Sieving
